title.value: Beyond Gaussian Noise: A Generalized Approach to Likelihood Analysis with non-Gaussian Noise
title.justification: Title explicitly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Beyond Gaussian Noise: A Generalized Approach to Likelihood Analysis with non-Gaussian Noise

extractions.description: The paper introduces Score-based LIkelihood Characterization (SLIC), a framework for building a data-driven noise model using noise realizations from observations. SLIC uses diffusion generative models to estimate the gradient of the probability density of noise and Langevin sampling to produce independent samples from the likelihood. The framework is demonstrated using real data from the Hubble Space Telescope and James Webb Space Telescope.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results using real data from telescopes and demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed framework.
type.quote: In this section, we present the results of our experiments to model and sample likelihoods in the presence of non-Gaussian noise using SLIC. We use Hubble Space Telescope (HST ) and James Webb Space Telescope (JWST ) imaging data.

name.justification: The paper addresses challenges in likelihood analysis related to non-Gaussian noise specifically in the context of astrophysics.
name.quote: This is a major limitation for precision measurements in many domains of science, including astrophysics.

name.justification: The core contribution of the paper is a new framework for likelihood analysis in the presence of non-Gaussian noise.
name.quote: This work presents Score-based LIkelihood Characterization (SLIC), a framework that resolves this issue by building a data-driven noise model using a set of noise realizations from observations.
